website_summaries.verdict: The type of secondary TOEFL prep book that offers general ESL learning strategies and practice.
pros: The writing of the book is easy to understand and follow during long periods of study time
Focuses on general ESL and the particular differences of American English words and grammar
cons: The lack of TOEFL-specific test prep means you will need additional books or study material

customer_reviews.title: Unsuitable for beginning ESL students.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book a few weeks ago to use to teach my ESL class. Unfortunately, the English that's presented in this book is the everyday English that we native speakers speak to our friends. There is just to much slang, dropping of letters, and other shortcuts that are unsuitable for the beginning ESL student. I will have to look for another book, which is too bad as I had high hopes for this one. Take care.

customer_reviews.title: Good book for intermediate learners
customer_reviews.text: It's a good book for learning American idioms and culture for intermediate learners. Yes, some terms that they explain are very simple, while others are advanced, they should have indicated the advanced ones so that beginners can skip them. If you are a beginner you may benefit from somebody telling you which words you should focus on and which you should ignore for now.

customer_reviews.title: I have always looked for a fun, but informative way to get my message across

Kudos to the authors for using their years of experience to answer this very real need in the ESL classroom. I see this as a "must have" for anyone interested in being a more informed and effective educator or an ESL student who wants to have fun and learn.

customer_reviews.text: Although casually written, featuring lots of slang, this is a solid guide to everyday American English with some excellent culture sections. A CD of of key dialogs is included which is rathed dated technology; a website with audio files would be better.

In the dialogues and other text, vocabulary words are in bold font, so the student can look ahead a half-page or so to see the word. customer_reviews.text: Very nice book. Really helpful for me. There are a bunch of useful words if you are going to visit America or if you are move in here to live. It more intermediate level, so you know.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Knopf

customer_reviews.title: One of the best ESL books I have ever read
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow guide to master daily American English. I give 4 stars because target audience is unclear. I don't know my English level. Probably I am somewhere between Upper Intermediate and Advanced but if I were a complete Beginner or just beginner, I wouldn't understand many of the sentences in this book.
